alert.note: Alert for Labette; Montgomery; Neosho (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:18AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Labette, southeastern Neosho and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 218 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mccune to near Liberty to near Copan. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parsons, Coffeyville, Independence, Cherryvale, Caney, Oswego, Chetopa, Altamont, Edna, Dearing, Mound Valley, Tyro, Liberty, Bolton, Bartlett, Labette, Parsons Tri City Airport, Lake Parsons, Angola and Dennis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
